Cruise.com Host Agency Division was established in 1998 and is currently accepting experienced agents and offers a sub-affiliate program. Cruise.com offers 3 hosting packages ranging from $348-$588 annually with commission rates that range from 85%-100% (depending on package). 
All of Cruise.com packages include an agent booking system with consumer-facing technology included in the price of 2 of the packages. Choices include a hosted consumer website branded with the agent‚Äôs information or a consumer booking engine widget to put on the agent‚Äôs own website.

Cruising Free was founded in 2010 and is the host agency division of the well-known Cruise Brothers Travel Agency founded in 1972, created on the belief that travelers can become travel agents.
Cruising Free is completely free to join because we seek those with a passion for leisure travel and cruising, are the "go to" for their family, friends or organization and want to learn how to create a home-based business easily whether keeping it simple or creating large groups or family reunions AND getting paid for it.
We've designed a proprietary intranet and education program led by a team of coaches or "Team Leaders" who are your personal guides from the day you begin. We do this because we know people joining us are new and want to do this part-time to earn money, save on travel and potentially earn free travel and cruises for the planning they are already doing. Of course we find that for some their passion turns into a full-time business and all this at no cost to you!

About Cruises-N-More
Cruises-n-More is a family owned and operated host agency that was founded in 1998 by Pat Neidhardt. Pat became a home based travel agent in 1989 and eventually opened up her own host agency, Cruise-n-More, in 1998.Cruises-n-More is ranked as one of the top 1% of cruise agencies in the US based. For home based travel agents under the Cruises-n-More umbrella, this translate into lower prices and added amenities for the clients.

CTP/Rennert Travel is owned by Christy Prescott. The CTP/Rennert Travel host agency is located in San Antonio, TX. It is the largest privately held travel management company in Texas and among the top 100 travel agencies in the nation. 
Rennert Travel has roots all the way back to 1898 and has since expanding their storefront to offer a host agency division. Commission plans offered are: 50%, 70%, and 100%. CTP/Rennert Travel work with both leisure and corporate travel agents and can be contacted at 830.964.2464.

Cupcake Castles Travel Company | Host Agency Reviews
Welcome and thank you for considering Cupcake Castles Travel Company as your new home in business :) We are a team of heart-centered, caring professionals who take a personal interest in the success and well-being of our team.
At Cupcake Castle Travel Co, our Travel Advisors are set to launch their businesses with all the tools needed to succeed, by providing results-driven marketing and sales training. Our proprietary 1:1 coaching program, D-School, launched in 2015. Since its inception, our program has produced results that have catapulted the successes of our agents by at least 12 months. They are seeing commissions paid to them within the first three months of launch, if not sooner.
Our agents are offered opportunities to further their product and destination knowledge, both virtually and in destination. All of our agents maintain beyond the highest level of experience, education and customer service available to them. Click here to learn more about our opportunity!

About Darino Travel
At Darino Travel, we are committed to empowering our agents by providing unparalleled value through access to industry-leading expertise, exclusive preferred hotels, and innovative technology solutions.
Our goal is to ensure that every agent has the resources they need to deliver exceptional travel experiences to their clients. We offer a network of prescreened hotels, ensuring that our agents can confidently recommend the best accommodations while streamlining the booking process with advanced technology. With our support, agents can grow their business with ease and confidence.
Mission: Darino Travel strives to provide exceptional value to our Agents by providing access to unique expertise, prescreened preferred hotels, advanced technology while paying industry leading commissions.

Dreams Travel Consulting is passionate about helping others build a successful home-based travel business. 
Welcome and thank you for your interest. We are a full service boutique agency. We are Earmarked with Disney(Authorized Disney Vacation Planners). Our goal is to provide all the tools needed for our advisors to work in the travel industry. There is new-to-the-industry training along with one on one mentorship, monthly and quarterly meetings, supplier training, and more. And for experienced advisors, we offer guidance as well. Over time as competition with larger OTA‚Äôs grew in this space, Fareconnect expanded into brick-and-mortar stores adding Home -Based Agents who were associated with the brick-and-mortar locations. In 2014, Fareconnect decided to restructure the company and move to a more centralized organization to support and recruit independent contractors. In 2015, Fareconnect reduced its number of stores to two locations in Medicine Hat Alberta and Winnipeg Manitoba. These stores restructured to add training and support of all IC‚Äôs, as the company transitioned to a fully functionable Host Agency. To better support its IC‚Äôs in 2019, Fareconnect consolidated all its operation to one location in Winnipeg. AAA Western and Central NY
Why AAA WCNY?
When you think of AAA you may think road service, TripTik or TourBooks. While those are all accurate, AAA also has a thriving full service travel agency. In January 2012, AAA Western and Central New York took a leap into the travel landscape and created our AAA Magic Creator Program -- AAA Independent Contractor Program. This took off 10+ years ago and we've not looked back.
We are a small teAAAm, only 75 IC's, but we are mighty. Our IC's can specialize in specific destinations/products or are open to sell all vacations. Our IC's work when it's convenient and are their own boss however each independent consultant is partnered with an internal partner to assist with questions, concerns and/or guidance.

Incentive Connection Travel | Host Agency Reviews
When choosing a Host Agency, look for one that:
Is large enough to give you the benefits of strong industry ties and support, but not so large that you get lost in numbers.
Will not attempt to steal your clients
Is financially stable
Has been in business a long time and pays commissions on time, every time
Ask if you are allowed to work directly with supplier BDMs. Are you isolated and/or limited to the questions you can ask a supplier?
Is there co-op money you can tap to help you with your marketing programs?
Are you continually made aware of industry happenings, promotions and events, or are you on your own to get this information?
And, most importantly, cares about you and your success
Support When You Need It
In these less than optimal times, agents need strong support. Through our close supplier relationships, Orbitz, Travelocity and Expedia are no longer impediments to closing the deal. Our agents can offer the same prices with a smile, and the personal service the Internet agencies do not.
Since we have no retail trade, our business model is 100% based on agent support with the philosophy that if the agent does not succeed, neither do we.
Being part of a mega franchise company might sound intriguing, but they are highly regulated and limit what you can and cannot do within your own business. You are an Independent Contractor, and as such, are governed by the IRS rules for ICs. You are entitled to run your business in any way you choose (within the guidelines of the industry and good business practices), build your business to the max and should you decide to leave, your clients go with you..not stay as a house account of your former Host Agency.
Travel Leaders Network
Travel Leaders is one of the world‚Äôs most respected consortia. TLN membership offers greater discounts, programs, higher commissions due to the volume it gives its preferred suppliers. Some of the TLN Programs we offer at no cost to all our agents are: the Hotel and Cruise Amenities programs, where you can offer amenities for hotel bookings and group rates on a one cabin sale, convenience of a Host on board, complimentary private cocktail party, bottle of wine, free Shore Excursion(s), robe or other pillow gifts‚Ä¶all in your name as your clients agent and at no cost to you

Please note: Host Agency Reviews considers Inteletravel an MLM hybird. Read more on Travel MLMs and why we encourage prospective agents to fully understand the MLM business model before signing on.
Inteletravel is a host agency - MLM hybrid based out of Delray Beach, FL.PlanNet Marketing is the MLM partner of Inteletravel. The cost to join Inteletravel is $179.99 and then $39.99 a month thereafter. Agents that join Inteletravel are considered ITAs (independent travel agents). Commission splits start at 70% commission and can move up to 80% commission once certain sales goals are achieved. ITAs are not currently able to register to become an ITA via Inteletravel. At the moment, the only way to join Inteletravel is going through PlanNet Marketing, then you can join Inteletravel.

The Travel Agent Next Door is based in Canada with more then 75 staff to support you!! They offer three main programs: 1) Supporting Store Front locations 2) Supporting Independent Contractors 3) Training new agents to become Travel Professionals. Travel agents working with The Travel Agent Next Door can expect to earn between 65% - 100% of the commission. TTAND has a tiered approach to supplier's commissions, a little different than most host agencies. They have 3 supplier levels: Preferred, Approved and all others. For example, when selling Preferred suppliers you will earn at a minimum of 85% - 100% commission and these include suppliers: RCI, Transat, ACV, AC, Celebrity, TravelBrands just to mention a few. Depending on the program and your revenue productivity, there may be no annual fees, which is a savings of $499.. Monthly fees range from $19 to $69/month. Contract terms are 1 year for experienced agents, 2 years for BRAND NEW to TRAVEL AGENTS (Bronze/Silver/Gold)

Gateway Travel Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
Hey Richard
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. We truly value the experiences and insights of our community members, as they help us grow and improve.
We're delighted to hear that you appreciated our extensive list of suppliers and found our support staff helpful. Providing a robust network and dedicated support is something we pride ourselves on, and it's wonderful to know that these aspects have positively impacted your experience.
Regarding our supplier selection, we restrict suppliers based on previous predatory experiences. Part of our responsibility is to thoroughly vet our suppliers to ensure that our agents are protected and can operate in a secure and supportive environment. (Basically we make sure they pay you).
We're also excited about our Social Media Spark program, which is designed to ignite creativity among our agents. This program has helped many of our agents make hundreds of additional bookings in its first year and I'm sorry that wasn't your experience. Additionally, we recently launched over 500 creative Canva templates available for our agents to use for free‚Äîdid you have a chance to check those out?
In terms of training, we've significantly expanded our offerings. We now have 20 different training courses with over 500 classes, including weekly live sessions and direct supplier training. Have you had the opportunity to explore these resources? We believe they provide valuable, tailored support for both new and experienced agents.
We understand your concerns about our CRM system. We launched the new Portal on January first, and all existing agents are in the process of transferring over next month. Unfortunately, when working with advanced technology and AI, some delays can occur.
To ensure a smooth transition for our existing agents, we have a thorough onboarding process designed to place them in the perfect spot for their production level. This includes group Zoom support with our staff and a unique, new group each quarter depending on growth and experience.
For our new agents, we offer live group sessions every week along with 1-1 support calls available anytime you want to schedule them. Our live new agent group sessions are tailored to provide the guidance and support needed to kickstart your journey with Gateway Travel.
At Gateway Travel, our mission is to support our agents in every possible way, and your success is our success. We are continuously working to enhance our services and resources to better serve our community. We would love the opportunity to discuss your experience further and explore how we can better support you moving forward. Please feel free to reach out to your agency contact directly.
For others reading this review, if you're interested in learning more about what Gateway Travel has to offer, please email us at newagentsupport@gatewaytravel.com to set up a "learn about" call. Additionally, you can stay connected and get the latest updates by joining us live on Facebook and YouTube twice a week.
Thank you again for your constructive feedback and for being a valued member of the Gateway Travel community. We're committed to making positive changes and hope to exceed your expectations in the future.
Warm regards,
Josh

Its been just a few months for us in this business. We chose MTravel based on the glowing reviews here and after spending hours looking at various host options and what each had to offer in the way of support , training, technology, resources and access. The exposure so far to suppliers and training are what we had hoped for. The new technology roll out shows lots of promise and a solid vision for future development and was a much needed update. 
Some of that roll out felt a bit rushed- taking sites down during business hours was a bit rough, occasional hiccups in data results/presentation and the way information has or has not been sorted in the new agent portal. I know it will get fixed- so I'm being patient. 
Perhaps it is growing pains/challenges with the CTM merger, but I would say as well, the inconsistencies in responding to support requests/ emails is probably my one issue to date. Often more than a couple days to hear back from someone. It is acknowledged, when joining MTravel that they take a bigger commission split for new agents because they anticipate doing more hand holding. However when you can't get responses in a timely manner or help is only available M-F business hours, I'm not sure what extra hand holding I am getting for the higher split. 
We believe MTravel has a solid foundation. Hoping they are able to resolve the technology and communication challenges going forward. Staying hopeful and patient.

Dear Bob, 
I am sorry to hear about negative experience with our host agency. I double checked with our team to get a little background on what happened to see if anything can be done. From my understanding, there was an issue with your groups being booked with non-preferred suppliers. When the booking was submitted, it was submitted as ‚ÄúMisc Tour‚Äù which defaults to non-preferred status in our system. According to our contract, all bookings made with a non-preferred supplier will be subject to a reduction in the regular commission split by 10% (example: 70/30 split will be paid at 60/40 split). We do offer a non-preferred supplier exemption request form that if filled out and approved at the time of booking, the agent will get paid at their regular commission split. Unfortunately, in your case, the form was not filled out for any of the groups that you have had with us over the years. This policy at has been in place since 2015 and we were not able to make an exception. Our team did offer to make sure to assist you on future groups so this does not happen again, but you decided to decline the offer and leave our agency. We do wish you all the best in your future endeavors. The door is always open if things change in the future. Best,

My orginal host agency was purchased by Altour/ The Travel Authority in summer 2010. Any one who has a host knows that when new owners come in things will/may change. Invoicing and getting paid acurately was difficult and still is. The invoice system is long and needs dozens of little tid bits of infor to identify (such BS when you see how other hosts do it.) They seem to misplace commission alot but always paid when you did all the research to find the payment they recieved. Spring of 2012 (about 18 months later) out of the blue hosted agents get a email letter commission across the board will go to 60/40% split. Most of us were at 80/20 or 70/30. I left, unfortunatley 30,000 of commission is still in limbo because I could NOT transfer owner ship to new host Nexion, which is a vendor issue. I was orginally told I could take ALL my bookings. When we figured out that would not be possible (again a vendor/ MLT system issue) thats when real trouble started! Becuase the split was going to be huge (20% less for me) I wrote to the coordinator told Altour I would not be making NEW reservations and here is the list of travelers (MY clients) for the remainder of the year (last group travels Nov 2012) I expect to have access to my log ins and client files until they are done and get paid 80% these where made prior to the announcement. The "work around" is to make a new log in ID with ad min rights.... meaning I could DELETE thier log in ID's.... I would NOT do that but really people. Stay away! Avoya Travel Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
I left Avoya after 6 months due to disagreement with their commission structure for leads and their marketing philosophy. I have been in sales my whole career - and this is the only company I know where the customer cannot choose who they work with. 
As a new TA, I was enticed by the training and onboarding program, and the opportunity to get leads with Avoya. However, after I earned $80 on a $5000 cruise I realized their model is flawed. Basically, you earn 4.8% on most cruise leads - it is a 30-70 split on leads, with 30% to you....after deducting any offers you made to the client. 
They want you to sell on value, but in training the first thing they push is to offer a discount or onboard credit. What they don't tell you is that any OBC you offer is deducted from your commission at the 80/20 or 30/70 lead split. Teaching you to offer a discount on your iniital call with a client is not adding value, and cuts your pay.
Avoya spends a lot of marketing, and they want to protect their investment - but the reason the leads stay with Avoya is because of the TA and how we bring the lead to closure, and maintain the customer relationship. However, they still keep the 30-70 split on all future deals as well.Even though they were only responsible for the initial lead. 
And then we received a letter from their CEO that said they would sue any TA that left and worked with a client that was previously a lead. Meaning the customers you had fostered and nurtured were not allowed to leave Avoya and follow you. Never in my career had I ever seen a policy like this - while I should not be allowed to poach any leads if I left, a customer should be able to use me if they wanted to, and found me on their own. Avoya threatened all agents with lawsuits should a client follow us no matter what. That is not a company I wanted to be associated with. 
I left and am very happy with my new agency I am associated with.

A passion project in retirement that turned into a thriving business: Two reasons why and the how: 
First, a little background: After twenty years of trading risk arbitrage and equity derivatives in downtown manhattan, the time had come for chapter two, or no chapter at all; the latter option was not appealing. My dad said, "what about being a travel advisor? You love to travel, have a great client list and have been to +60 countries. We use an advisor and it makes all the difference in the world?" I love the idea, but where do you begin?
With Wall Street clientele, the appeal of Virtuoso as the luxury leader in travel helped me narrow my search for a host agency on this very site. The other requirement was a real education; only GTN had both. The year-long program was vital to my success. One could launch without the education on the back of my extensive travel and business experience, but aren't your odds of success drastically higher if you are a true expert? Doesn't that take immersion and mentorship? Would I have done more damage to my budding travel reputation with the finance clients I hoped to convert to travel clients had I not? Would I get more than one chance from those clients?
Fast forward to December 2021, I am in GTN's top producers club (top 30) in my first full year of business! I am invited to the Virtuoso ultraluxe community, attended Belmond's signature Bellini event for 10 USA advisors in Sicily and was on a top producer retreat with GTN. Without education, it would not have unfolded this way and certainly not this quickly. 
The second reason is: In real estate, the most valuable metric is location, location, location, but at a host agency, it is culture, culture, culture. The collaboration and support amongst advisors in our community is the silver bullet and goes hand in hand with the educational foundation of GTN. Imagine how much the collective mindshare benefits our clients. I was not expecting instant responses to questions or requests for advice yet opening up the browser to 7 responses in thirty minutes is common. It's another level of vetting and advocacy, but it only happens if the culture is there. We are not competing like local real estate agents who might compete for a listing in town. Our clients are worldwide, an enviable difference, and it means we are not competing so let's help each other win. We share tips, insights and experiences on our internal system in discussion groups that pale in comparison to snarky online forums. We travel together, 14 GTN advisors and I are just back from 12 days in Tanzania, and as a result, we grow together. It's made all the difference in professional growth inspired by culture and education. What more can you ask for?
Stuart Marra

PTN Travel Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with PTN. I‚Äôm truly sorry to hear that your journey with us didn‚Äôt meet your expectations. We value all feedback, as it helps us refine our processes and improve the support we provide.
I‚Äôm glad you felt welcomed during the discovery call and appreciated the personal onboarding experience. Our goal is always to ensure our advisors feel supported, especially in the early stages of their business. That said, I understand that every advisor‚Äôs needs are different, and it seems we may have missed the mark in a few areas.
Regarding our systems, I‚Äôd like to clarify that Travefy is currently a lite CRM, but it is actively working on expanding its capabilities to become a full CRM solution. While our agent portal is a true portal, our supplier list is hosted on Google Sheets to allow for real-time updates. As a growing agency, we frequently add new suppliers, and this tool helps us keep the process streamlined and up-to-date.
We do encourage booking with Virtuoso suppliers as they provide our advisors with the luxury perks and benefits that come with our network. This is part of the value that PTN offers as a luxury agency, and it‚Äôs why many of our members choose to work with us. However, we also understand that some advisors may seek flexibility, and we are always open to discussing options outside our preferred suppliers list.
Our orientation sessions are intended to provide a light introduction to all areas of our business and are followed by in-depth coaching and training multiple times per week. These sessions are designed to be actionable and specific, and I‚Äôm sorry to hear that you felt they were too generic. We aim to offer meaningful, personalized guidance to help you grow your business.
We also have a variety of workflows and templates available on our agent portal, and our coaching staff is always ready to assist. Our support system is designed to ensure advisors can easily reach out via support tickets or schedule one-on-one calls. Our leadership team works full-time for PTN and, as active travel advisors themselves, they are fully equipped to assist our advisors.
Regarding the onboarding requirements, we ask new advisors to form an LLC and secure E&O insurance, as these are essential for protecting both the advisor and PTN. These requirements are discussed upfront during the discovery call.
Lastly, we use Sion as our commission tracking software, which is one of the best tools in the industry for managing commissions. As independent contractors, our advisors are responsible for taking the initiative to attend coaching and training sessions and integrating these learnings into their business. We offer a supportive environment, but the drive for success ultimately comes from the individual.
We wish you nothing but the best in your journey as a travel advisor.

Outside Agents Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
Let me start this off by saying that I think Outside Agents is a great company for someone breaking into the industry. They provide a good path to get you started, basic business training, etc. They are a family run business which is extremely important, but may also be to their detriment which I will get into later. Most people at Outside Agents genuinely care about you and your success and you can tell that in the pride that they have for the company. Obviously in giving a three star review, you can assume there may have been some negatives, which I will get into now.
Firstly, there is a gentleman that works for Outside Agents who while is extremely knowledgeable about the industry and the company, and has a good relationship with SOME agents, his demeanor and interaction with others is extremely unprofessional. I notice it almost daily on the Facebook group and within the message boards where he will lambaste agents for asking the wrong thing and the answer for mostly everything is refer to the LMS or why didn't you take the training. In one interaction, he explicitly called my advice wrong and said I should not be posting. As a representative of a company that both takes a monthly fee and part of your commission, he should be a steward for the agents and act in a professional and customer service-oriented manner. I can tell you without hesitation that he is the main reason I am moving away from Outside Agents this year.
Secondly, while the one owner focuses a lot in AI and innovation, the technology behind the company is sorely lacking. The CRM looks like something from the mid to late 2000's. It works for some and others it does not. If you bring up it doesn't work for you the answer is to do the training. The provided websites are basic at best and lack any advanced feature sets. They also all are the same Wordpress template which can be detrimental to SEO rankings. Their in person trainings have no virtual option for those that work for a living. When asked the answer was "we tried it once and it didn't work". Fair enough, but every company on the planet has some sort of virtual piece to them. Every training that I pay for for my day job is virtual and it works extremely well. I'm not saying go all virtual, but have the option at least for those that cannot spend the money to go. For a company that is centered around innovation, the lack of any sort of input from their IC's is troublesome. They are family owned, which gives them the latitude to do as they please without input, which as I mentioned may be to their detriment. 
In conclusion, Outside Agents will work for many and will not be the right fit for some. I am part of the "some" and will be moving away this year. I wrote this review to be open and honest, and to show that while a company can be 5 stars in certain areas, it could use improvement for others.

Million Miles Travel Agency Host Reviews
Million Miles Travel was my host agency and I have leveraged Tammy's support of group travels, using WeTravel. Tammy is a lawyer so I want to be careful that I do not make any claims that are not completely factual.
Short story: 
My clients made their full payment through WeTravel (where it went into an escrow account solely controlled by Tammy), with the expectation that money would be paid to the operator. Instead Tammy took the money out of the account (less $0.20) and did NOT pay the operator. 
Tammy has not responded to emails/messages/calls for 6 weeks.
I cannot refund the customers without Tammy returning the money to WeTravel. The operator can't run a trip without being paid, and the customers can't get their money back.
The only way the trip can happen at this point is if I pay for the trip myself for my clients, or my clients pay twice, through no fault of their own or the operator.
Longer version: 
- My clients paid in full in February 2025 (for a trip in May 2025) via WeTravel, which means the money was in the WeTravel account owned/controlled by Tammy. 
- Tammy was supposed to pay the deposit in early March and communicated with me and the operator about it (but did *not* complete the deposit payment) 
- On March 12 she stopped responding to all texts, voicemails, emails, FB messages. 
- On March 31, she sent a BCC'd email saying she'd been in an accident but would get to all priority items even though she had limited connectivity 
- I continued to message on all channels to get her to pay the operator for the deposit+full amount due for the trip (or allow me access to the funds); no response 
- On April 11, I tried to refund the customers via weTravel, but discovered there was only 20 cents in the escrow account... so she had NOT paid the operator, but took all the funds out (less 20 cents) 
- I cannot refund the customers. I messaged/called asking her to replace my clients' funds many times. Again, no response. 
- Radio silence. It's been another 11 days, with no response.
Tammy has possession of my clients' money, hasn't paid the operator, and I can't refund them (for a trip that was supposed to start in less than one month now).
This has been my worst travel agent's nightmare: If I want my customer's trip to still happen, I have to pay out of my own pocket, while Tammy has my clients' money in her own pocket. 
I would not recommend working with Tammy for situations where she is the blocker for getting money to your suppliers. There is no redundancy. If she goes dark, is sick, gets into an accident, etc, there is no backup or way for you to get help. Your money is with Tammy and you have no access to it, which makes it impossible to run a travel agency. 
I have also reported this situation to the California Department of Justice (the clients are from California and Million Miles Travel has a SOT license for CA) as well as the Brooklyn District Attorney -- since holding client's money without paying for their trip or without refunding them if it is canceled for lack of operator payment, seems antithetical to good business practices.
If anyone does have open communication lines with Tammy, I would really appreciate it if you could kindly ask her to return my customer's money to weTravel so they can be refunded. I have been advised to "lawyer up" to try to get my client's money back since Tammy isn't responding to me -- but I would very much love love LOVE to avoid that pathway if she could just return the money.

Dream Vacations Advisor Host Reviews
Dream Vacations has been an excellent hybrid option for me. I work full-time, but love travel. Having lived overseas and been to almost 50 countries, the allure of being an agent was too great! I wanted access to better prices for travel, and to get paid for all the travel I was already booking for people. 
The training was simple, and I was off to the races. So far I have booked 16 trips since last summer, all of them land bookings. It has been an absolute blast and my franchise owner is a rockstar. 
A couple of notes. 1. don't think you will get rich doing this. Most vacations outside of cruises and all-inclusive pay very little. Which is ok, but I don't think I fully understood it. 2. Dream Vacations takes royalties, then your franchise takes some (obviously) and then you get the leftover. Again, this makes sense, but I didn't fully understand how much they would take. On some of the smaller bookings where you only make $100 in commission, that doesn't leave a whole lot left over for you. Just something to be aware of. 3. Dream Vacations values cruises over all else. Many of the suppliers I work with my amazing Franchise owner helped me with as Dream vacations did very little with them. Many times we have had to go to the drawing board on things to figure out how to make it work as most training is only about cruises. My strong suit is land travel as that is what I have done the most of, so that is what I sell. It is obviously entirely possible, but something to know. Lastly, the discounts weren't as epic as I had built up in my head :) Through Dream vacations I was able to get my CLIA certification which gets me access to certain discounts, but otherwise you aren't allowed to book through most of the preferred suppliers for yourself (even if you don't make commission) and the discounts you always see people rave about aren't actually that common. Again, just something that is useful to know going into it. 
Overall, this is an incredible program with a lot of room for growth. I am now certified to sell Disney and Marriott, have the ability to help people plan a detailed trip, and am constantly gaining new knowledge. I am very grateful and will be here for many years to come! If you love travel, you love to book it, and want to make some extra money, this is a great option.

Incentive Connection Travel Host Reviews
A Trusted Partner for Over 19 Years - A review of Incentive Connection Travel as a Host Agency
I have been in the travel industry for over 40 years and have spent the last 19 of those years with Incentive Connection Travel (ICT) as my host agency. Choosing ICT was one of the best decisions I made for my business. Even coming in with extensive experience-including time in storefront agencies, holding an IATAN card, being a member of ASTA, and bringing a loyal client base-I found the support and connection through IICT to be a key factor in helping my business continue to thrive.
What makes ICT stand out is their dedication to growth-not just their own, but yours as an agent. From the very beginning, the owners have provided unwavering support, truly investing in my success. They offer the tools, relationships, and communication platforms that help you stay informed, educated, and connected. Despite being headquartered in Arizona, ICT supports a nationwide network of agents seamlessly. Geography is never a barrier when you're part of this community.
One of the most valuable aspects of being with ICT is the sense of connection. As a home-based Independent Contractor, it can be easy to feel isolated, but ICT makes sure that does not happen, if you communicate with others. Through supplier-hosted webinars, new agent helps session, and virtual training opportunities, we stay informed and inspired. The annual conferences-with face-to-face time with suppliers-are truly a great way to be noticed and add a personal dimension that makes a big difference in relationship-building and learning.
Our Facebook group and regular supplier webinars have been a constant source of insight and advice. It's a place where agents collaborate, share experiences, and support one another. ICT has cultivated not just a host agency, but a professional family.
ICT has grown with us, and because of their continued efforts to evolve, so have I. If you're looking for a host agency that is committed to your success, provides genuine support, and fosters a strong community of agents-you will find that with Incentive Connection Travel.

Nexion Travel Group-Canada Host Reviews
After 15 years in the financial industry, I got the idea that I should be a travel agent. In all honesty, it started as a silly idea. I didn't know anything or a single person in the travel industry who could offer me any insight. I thought the only option was to go apply at a brick and mortar and I certainly didn't want to do that. When I learned about being home based, I was sold. 
Research began for me on the internet of course. Websites such as this one and others started giving me ideas of how to open your own travel agency. I read the pros and cons of using a host or going completely independent. 
I attended Cruise3Sixty in April and decided to join Nexion Canada in May. I thought their sign-up fee and monthly fees were very reasonable unlike other hosts that require a huge start-up. I didn't have thousands of dollars to start this new business and I certainly didn't want to take that much risk in case I failed. Nexion also offers a Power Up training program, perfect for such a newbie like myself.
Nexion's Power Up program is phenomenal. They have pre-recorded sessions you can listen to at your own pace AND refer back to when you need to do something live for the first time. In addition, I really appreciated the one-on-one weekly sessions with the trainer. What was important to me and still is, is being able to reach out to Nexion when I have a question and to get a timely response. 
I chose the option to brand myself and I really like feeling like I'm the owner of my own travel agency. Nexion provides the back office support I need. I truly feel that they support me and my business and sincerely want me to succeed. It's only been a short few months and I would never have imagined that I would be where I am today if it weren't for them. 
I am looking forward to my future as a home based travel agent with Nexion.

Travel Edge Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
Joining Travel Edge as my host agency has been an extraordinary experience, and I couldn't be more thrilled about the decision. From the moment I became part of this remarkable network, I've been consistently impressed by the level of support, innovation, and opportunities available to me.

Beyond the tools and partnerships, what truly sets Travel Edge apart is the sense of community and support. The collaborative environment encourages growth, learning, and sharing of best practices, which has been invaluable to my personal and professional development.

I am very happy to be affiliated with MEI-Travel and Mouse Fan Travel. I started their training program in January, 2013. 
It was an intensive program that helped me become a successful travel planner. Beci Mahnken, the owner and CEO, is very responsive to any questions or needs of the agents affiliated with her company. The management and administrative staff are always available to offer the support or additional resources that we need to do our job. I feel that the commission percentage they offer is fair and our independent contractor fees are reasonable. My previous industry experience was always in the group incentive and convention side of travel, but never in the individual leisure side. After much research and speaking with many different agencies, I decided to sign on with Lake Shore Travel. Below is why I am confident I made the right decision. 
Besides having passion for travel, I wanted to ensure my business provided truly customized experiences. Our company would consistently focus on the client and provide options that came from listening to the client and discovering the purpose of the trip. Therefore, I needed a host agency that was going to have constant communication with me and supported me and trained me to provide this type of service. It would need to give me much more than just access to an IATA # and systems. Because of this, I narrowed it down to two agencies. But the reason I picked Lake Shore was as follows: 
1. The affiliation with Lake Shore provides an outstanding network for my clients and strengthens the negotiation power we have to provide upgrades, amenities and insider experiences through the Virtuoso network for our clients. Not to mention the amazing relationships Lake Shore has with vendors throughout the globe. Since joining Lake Shore whenever I explained to a Vendor I was new to the industry and looking for some help. Multiple vendors would say, ‚ÄúYou have joined the best team‚Äù or ‚ÄúLake Shore always takes care of the advisors and their clients.‚Äù That is exactly what I wanted for my clients. 
2. The training was great and does not stop after that first week in their office. You can call or email at any time. Plus the training doesn‚Äôt just come from the training manager or your mentor. The entire team really wants to help. I have spoken with multiple people in the office and they have all offered suggestions or offered to help. You definitely don‚Äôt feel alone. The support system is incredible. 
3. At no time, did I feel like I was a number or a member of training class. I was always a person with a name. The boutique feel of Lake Shore is a benefit. From the CEO, to the office manager, to HR, to the part-time assistant. Every person welcomed me and wanted me to know they wanted me to be a success and would help me in any way that they could. 
I‚Äôve been with Lake Shore Travel for a short time. But I really do believe that my research paid off. You can get systems and training from pretty much anywhere. But the personalized support, the training support that continues throughout your first year, the team atmosphere, the vendors who go the extra mile because of who you are associated with, and the years of experience that you can learn from and transfer to your clients, that is what you get with Lake Shore Travel. That is the Lake Shore difference.

Finding a good host fit can be difficult. I was with another host but was not satisfied and searched for a new host for almost a year to find the right fit. I was looking for a host that worked with experienced agents and offered GDS (Apollo) capability. I wanted an agency with a great reputation, had established supplier relationships, paid commission in a timely manner, and who had friendly support staff. Although I knew I would be an IC, I wanted to feel I was a respected part of the team. 
I found all of this and more at Plaza Travel. I've worked with Plaza Travel for almost a year now. Steve and his team are a pleasure to work with and I feel I am part of the Plaza Travel "family". I receive updates and communication from Plaza Travel on a daily basis so never feel I am "out of the loop", yet they are hands-off enough to allow me to grow at my own speed. If I have a GDS issue, it is resolved quickly and courteously by their IT staff. I never have to worry about receiving commission because their accounting department is trustworthy and diligent. Their vendor relationships are strong and their relationship with Signature Travel Network is an added bonus to helping me to build my business. Plaza Travel is the perfect partner for growing my travel business and I cannot imagine being anyplace else.

Cruise Planners Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
Having been an independent contractor with a small Mom and Pop local travel agency that focused on Disney travel for about eight years, I had been looking to extend my wings and fly the proverbial chicken coop for a few years. Knowing there was more to travel than just Disney, I had been exploring options and investigating many agencies on and off for a couple years.
My family and I loved cruising, international travel and going to all-inclusive resorts, so I looked at 4-5 other well-known agencies, but really was impressed with Cruise Planners. No matter how many groups and consortiums I looked at, and which one I favored, I always kept going back to the "Team In Green!" They had ALL Travel covered and included, with great references, superb affiliations and a stellar reputation. 
When Covid hit in 2020, that is when I decided it was the ideal time for me to make my franchise purchase with Cruise Planners. Crazy? Nope. Ingenious? Yep!! Business had slowed enough to make a smooth transition with my existing client base (all family, friends and referrals) to attend Star-U, set-up my files, get all the updates and training completed and just GO for the gusto!!!
The technology, the people, the support, and the connections at Cruise Planners are the best of the best. The powerful CP affiliation is a badge of honor that I wear with pride daily! It was/is honestly the BEST decision I have ever made for business. I set aside the start-up funds, looked over the paperwork, signed and send, please take my money. Now, I am the boss of me and I LOVE IT!
I am so glad I finally mustered up the courage to take the leap of faith, trust my gut, go with my instincts and become a "GREENIE!" Since February 2021 I have added two Independent Contractors, one in 2022 and the other in 2023. We have successfully made it into the "Millionaire's Club" based on our overall sales annually for the past two years. We will continue to flourish, learning about new & exciting destinations, making new connections with various vendors, visiting new locations and venues and most importantly travelling all over discovering the world one continent at a time.
Michelle Fee is such a heroine and role-model for women-owned businesses and I contribute most of my CP success to her and her vision, her dreams and her drive that she injects into each of us on the daily (through webinars, newsletters, seminars, conferences, boot camps, summits, invitational events, the list just goes on and on and on). Support, care, commitment, compassion, love, family and success are all attributes that are associated with being a Cruise Planners Family Member, and we are ALL one big, happy FAMILY!
Cruise Planners is my dream come true! I am forever grateful, totally blessed and forever thankful for the Cruise Planners model for Travel Franchise Owners. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

NEST Plus Host Reviews | Host Agency Reviews
So I had a totally independent agency and I was looking for a new consortium and wanted to be part of NEST. I wasn't sure my sales were high enough (later I discovered they were more than) so when Rosemary told me there was host agency within NEST called NEST PLUS. It didn't take me the weekend to realize, I was tired of being alone and on my own. I needed to have some support. True support.
I have all I want and need from NEST and PLUS I have the backing and support of a strong, confident, pleasant, loving and kind family. I have described Nest, Nest Plus and Travelsavers as being a big tree, with many branches and lots of leaves. And that's what it really is. It's a home. 
I describe my once independent agency as a Boutique Host Agency. That means, we still take on new and sort of experienced agents, but, we are ourselves hosted. And I'm okay with that now. Everything I need is here, and if there is something I'd like to see, they take your suggestons and ideas serious.
There is a reason geese flock together and fly in a v formation. You can only be in the front for so long, and then you need to fall back and allow the wing support of all the others in your flock to help you get to your next destination. NEST PLUS is like that flock of geese. I was on my own for so long, I didn't even realize how much I needed the support of others to make it.
I can tell, the relationships with the agents and agency owners beind the scenes is one of family. They all care and share and want to see each other succeed. Thank you Rosemary, Wayen and Maureen for reminding me all the time, that sometimes, it's better to be part of a flock.
